Currency pairs belong to the Forex market. This category includes more than 40 financial instruments with the highest liquidity.
You can freely trade gold and silver in the CFD format. The precious metals market is considered one of the most promising and high-margin.
Choose the most promising and liquid shares of companies for transactions in the format of contracts for difference in prices.

Use stock indices to diversify your assets. The stock market is considered one of the most profitable due to high liquidity and predictable dynamics.
Digital tokens belong to the cryptocurrency market. Now you can trade cryptocurrency for the price difference. This significantly increases the potential profit from trading in any direction.
Advantages of the foreign exchange market
The Forex market has many advantages due to the possibility of using leverage, low margin requirements and high liquidity. Read more about the advantages of the foreign exchange market below.
You can make a profit on the foreign exchange market in any economic situation.

Transactions are not subject to taxes

What is the foreign exchange market?

CFDs on Forex allow you to trade all currency pairs on the market. You can trade the main pairs, including GBP / USD, USD / JPY, EUR / USD and AUD / USD. Minor Forex pairs, such as AUD / JPY and EUR / GBP, and exotic Forex pairs, such as USD / ZAR, are also available.

Feature of the CFD market of metals is the ability to open transactions in two directions: when the price of assets decreases or increases. To do this, you can use leverage, microlots and other special instruments.
There are no restrictions on the entry and exit price
You can open long and short positions at any price, as well as with any volume from 0.01 lot.
Due to the access to micro lots, it is possible to trade metals even with a small deposit, without risking a large amount of funds.
To open an order, you need to specify only a few basic parameters without any difficulties.
Buy and sell transactions are executed without pauses, requotes and slippages.

The world market of precious metals is one of the most balanced. It trades assets such as gold, silver, platinum and others. In this case, we are talking about CFDs. This is the most profitable trading format with low margin requirements.

CFD trading in stocks has many advantages. In this trading format, you do not need to become a shareholder and buy whole lots of assets. It is enough to open transactions for the difference in prices in any direction to get a potential profit.
Execution of transactions at any time
Transactions on the stock market can be carried out at any weekday, except on weekends.
Access to the leverage in transactions is provided automatically (you can choose the desired leverage yourself).
It is most convenient to track charts and control asset prices in our company's trading terminal.
Orders with shares of companies are executed without hidden payments, according to a pre-approved spread.
In this type of CFD trading, shares become the underlying asset. As with other CFD instruments, you do not own the asset, but agree with the supplier to speculate on the movement of the share price.

Through the trading platform of our brokerage company, you can trade major global commodities in the form of CFDs. When you open a CFD position on a certain commodity, you do not buy this commodity. Instead, you invest in changing the market price of this commodity.
Nowhere else will you be able to make transactions with commodities as easily as in CFD trading.
Even during a falling market, you can find a profit and earn a profit.
It will only take a couple of clicks to set up an order and specify the lot size, leverage and other parameters.
Spreads for transactions with goods are always market-based and transparent, without any requotes or slippages.

Trading in commodities in the CFD format is no different from trading in other asset classes. The purpose of any transaction is to buy an asset at a low price and sell it at a higher price. Or vice versa, if we are talking about a downtrend. This category includes the most liquid commodity positions: oil and gas.

The key feature of this market is the ability to open positions for a long time in the CFD format. In addition, the indices include many stocks. And this simplifies the modeling of market situations and facilitates forecasting.
Even with a minimum deposit, you can open transactions with stock indices for price differences.
Choose an individual trading style and use it without restrictions.
In traditional trading, transactions on the stock market are subject to a commission, but not in CFD trading.
Just imagine that you can open transactions on the stock market with one click of the mouse.
The stock market includes not only individual shares of companies, but also entire indices. They combine dozens or hundreds of securities of the same field of activity or direction.

Surely everyone has heard about the extreme volatility of the cryptocurrency market. This means that traders who use the CFD format receive the greatest profit here. Open an account and get direct access to it!
Trading cryptocurrency in the CFD format is allowed with any volume, starting from 0.01 lots.
You can open deals in any of the two directions, regardless of the market situation.
Cryptocurrencies are very volatile, but in CFD trading, you can make a profit even during a market fall.
For online cryptocurrency trading, you do not need to complete special courses or get a broker's license.

The cryptocurrency market includes dozens of digital tokens, including Bitcoin, Ripple, Dogecoin, Monero, Ethereum and many others. All these assets are based on cryptographic encryption technology. It is precisely because of the uniqueness of this system that the value of cryptocurrencies increases.
Check out the favorable terms of online trading with our brokerage company. Appreciate the low spreads, accelerated execution of transactions and high stability of orders.
A completely free online trader calculator is available to each of you right on this page. Specify the initial data and get a ready-made calculation of the potential outcome of the transaction.

Instrument:
specify the selected financial instrument from the list

Price:
specify the estimated price of opening and closing the order to see the possible result

Trade volume:
specify exact trade volume in lots

Spread in points:
calculated automatically based on the difference between Ask and Bid prices

Swap in USD:
calculated automatically based on the cost of position rollover at night

Margin:
the specified data is the minimum amount of free deposit required to make a transaction

Profit:
indication of probable profit based on current parameters

The activities of our brokerage company are certified by reputable regulators and independent financial commissions. You can learn more about partners and regulators on this page.
The FSA is the only regulatory organization in the islands of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, whose goal is to regulate the financial sector.

MiFID stands for the Directive on the Markets of Financial Instruments. It came into force in the EU in November 2007. The MiFID also describes the minimum capital requirements and mandatory segregation of client and corporate funds.
FINMA in Switzerland closely coordinates its activities with the regulatory authorities of other countries and operates as several banks around the world
CySEC is a reputable and trustworthy regulator and is considered the preferred jurisdiction for many forex companies.
One of the world's largest liquidity aggregators, which is known for the stability of quotes and a high level of reliability in data transmission.
The Currenex system offers direct quotes from market makers, instant order execution, the highest liquidity and maximum transparency.
IFSC (International Financial Services Commission), the International Financial Services Commission is the state regulator of Belize.
It is one of the largest banks in the world with total assets of $2.281 trillion. With a market value of $325 billion, it is the third largest bank in the world by market capitalization.
